definition: to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to escape/leisurely/outstanding
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: School curriculum should be reasonable, do students work and rest.
sentences.chinese: 學校應該合理地課改，做到讓學生勞逸結合。

sentences.english: Athletes understand that effective training comes from a combination of exercise and rest.
sentences.chinese: 運動員明白有效的訓練要勞逸結合。

sentences.english: They may actually get more toil out of you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，勞逸結合也許會讓你更加辛苦。

sentences.english: Only through reconciling work and rest can we improve efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 勞逸結合才能提高工作效率。

sentences.english: Has the time amusement, although said alternates work with rest, but works in where?
sentences.chinese: 有時間玩樂，雖然說勞逸結合，但是勞動在何處？

sentences.english: Next, must avoid overtiredly, the attention alternates work with rest.
sentences.chinese: 其次，要避免過度疲勞，注意勞逸結合。

sentences.english: Our today's terms, is the meaning of combining exertion and rest.
sentences.chinese: 拿我們今天的話來說，就是勞逸結合的意思。

sentences.english: Note physical exercise, combining exertion, to take part in physical activities.
sentences.chinese: 注意鍛鍊身體，勞逸結合，多參加體育活動。

sentences.english: To keep healthy, every one of us should work and rest.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保持健康，我們每個人都應勞逸結合。

definition: physical exercise
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!

Illness enters by the mouth (idiom). Mind what you eat!/fig. A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
to prevent heatstroke and reduce temperature
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
silence/solemnly silent/peaceful/to pacify
to make a breakthrough
to stay young forever

to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
to squander money/to spend extravagantly
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
greedy/glutton
